item.description:
Hi guys,

I copied the directions from another website but as I'm looking at Google maps, it's a little unclear to me exactly where we want to meet and park. It could be either Cedar Swamp Pond Rd, Folly Brook Terrace, or Green Rd. If you look at a map, they are all very close together.

Please put my number in your phones in case we need to check in with each other and don't worry if you can't find the exact spot right away. We'll wait for everyone to get there as long as I know you're coming!

Larry

603-969-3362

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Webster Wildlife and Natural Area is an 85-acre property owned by the Society for the Protection of NH Forests (SPNHF).

 It was acquired in 1972 mainly because it contains a rare Atlantic-White-Cedar Swamp.

Atlantic White Cedars are very long-lived trees that may exceed 300 years of age. The oldest in NH is about 225 years old. AWC swamps are characterized by cool, dark forest floors lush with moses and liverworts. They often contain unique plant and animal species including swamp azalea, dwarf huckleberry, and the rare Hessel's Hairstreak butterfly. This will be an easy walk of a few miles. We may do some mucking around in wet areas so waterproof/resistant boots are highly recommended. There's also a small state park nearby where we can go for a longer walk - and we can head into Amesbury for a drink afterward. 

No Pets.

Carpool: 11:30 AM @ Portsmouth Bus Station - Grafton Dr. There are two parking lots. Meet in the one farthest from the main bus terminal building, farther up Grafton Dr, at the very back of the lot. Call me if you can't find us!

Directions from the North: I-95 South to Exit #1 for Seabrook/Kingston, NH. Turn Right on Rt 107 West. Go 9 miles. Then follow directions from Rt 107.

Directions from the South: I-95 North to Exit #1 for Seabrook/Kingston, NH. Turn Left on Rt 107 West. Go 9 miles. Then follow directions from Rt 107.

From Rt 107: Turn Left on Rts 111 & 125 South. Go 2 miles. Turn Left on Folly Brook Terrace. Turn Right on Frontage Rd. Turn Left on Green Rd. Go about 1.5 miles. Turn Left on Cedar Swamp Pond Rd. Trail is about 1/4 mile ahead. The trailhead is a 40-45-minute drive from Portsmouth or Newburyport.

Learn more about Atlantic White Cedar Swamps here: http://www.nhdfl.org/library/pdf/FSAtlanticWhiteCedarSwamps2.pdf

Some Crude Wetland Definitions

Swamp: a wetland where trees or woody shrubs predominate

Marsh: a wetland predominantly of grasses

Fen: an alkaline, mineral-rich wetland often composed of tall, marsh plants

Bog: a very acidic, mineral poor, low-nutrient wetland often composed of low-lying plants. Bogs may contain carnivorous plants, sphagnum, cranberries, or blueberries, and may form a layer of peat as vegetation decomposes.

Time and location are subject to change due to weather and other factors.

Liability Release
AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING THIS MEETUP, YOU AGREE TO hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer and his heirs, and all members and participants of the Seacoast Outdoors Meetup group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons. You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. Kayaking, camping, hiking, bicycling, and other activities pose inherent risks and dangers. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment.  Fee is for meetup site expenses and planning only.
item.name: Webster Wildlife & Natural Area
